> <OLD>

> VICE GRIP listened over to the communication, pausing, "=
What do we know
> about this..  Leo Prime, I believe he identiifed himself =
as?  What are his
> capabilities?"
>
> At the very least, they already had =
more to go on than they had previously -
> they knew the name of the Prime.=


<NEW>

SKYSHADOW paused for a moment, his optics thoughtful. "We know som=
ething of him." He said carefully. "Not not as much as I would like. He is =
the spark 'child' of Lio Convoy, who you may know LIO CONVOY as one of the =
Maximals generals before the great peace accord set in?" 

He shook his hea=
d slightly, "No one knows who the mother is, some think This Leo . . . um. =
. . Jr  for want of a better term,  is a clone of his 'father'."

SKYSHADOW=
's optics brightened as another memory came to him. "If he is he, then that=
 means that Wing Caliber and Santon are not far away either. There is a rum=
or they they can become Magnaboss, although I have not actually seen that."=
 

> <OLD>
>
> DINOBOT nodded, "Of course.  We should send an escort along =
with HYDRAS for
> the neogtiations.  But we should hold the majorit of our =
forces back." 
> Pausing.  "And I would assume that the reason this second =
Prime has taken
> over the negotiations, given he mentioned a very large ja=
mming zone, is that
> TUSCON and perhaps part of the MAXIMAL forces are los=
t within the area or
> otherwise engaged in missions there."
>
> Glancing o=
ver, "What group of us will be escorting HYDRAS, what will be
> remaining a=
t base, and what will be going out on a salvage mission with
> Cryotek or w=
atching Tarantalus here?"

<NEW>

SKYSHADOW turned to DINOBOT, "I would not=
 want to encroach upon Hydras' perrogative." He said in that same careful m=
anner of his, sounding like the ever so loyal servant of HYDRAS. 

"But thi=
s is as big as this sounds." SKYSHGADOW said, talking about the conversatio=
n HYDRAS and LEO were having, "Then it is likely most of us will need to go=
, with a skeleton crew left here, perhaps I and my fuzors."

> <OLD>
>
> BL=
ACKARACHNIA gave a small wink to CRYOTEK, "Oh, please.  Assets are a
> muni=
tions bunker, or an information network.  Now these.."  Stroking her
> fore=
claw over her torso plating, "Are another realm entirely."  Teasing.
>
> St=
ill paying close attention to the conversation and updating TARANTALUS.

<N=
EW>

There was a playful smile and a raised optic ridge, "And tell me, whic=
h assets are you more comfortable in sharing?"

> <OLD>
>
> There was a shi=
ver along the cerebral link from BLACKARACHNIA, and a quiet
> nod, "As you =
wish.  Do you wish me to further interact with him or to
> prioritize mysel=
f upon CRYOTEK for now?"

> <NEW>

"BAH!" TARANTULUS said over their encryp=
ted transmission. "Hydras is so predictable." He words dimsive of Hydras' a=
bility. "Since Megatron and Galvatron *ahem* shall we say, joined forces, w=
hat has resulted has been lack luster to say the least."

There was a pause=
, "No." He said finally. "Keep a watch on Cryotek. He has an agenda, and I =
want to know what it is. It may have something to do with what we are facin=
g, or could be something different entirely."
